Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.GUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    The GUI class for handling the graphical interface.

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        This method is called from Main and creates the JFrame GUI as well as initializing the gameboard.

      • printMap

        public void printMap(Square[][] map)
        This method prints the game board within the JFrame GUI and handles Image Icons.
        Parameters:
        map - the 2 dimensional array of type square, represents the current game map.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        This method picks up when the user hits a key and runs the appropriate code to move or shoot.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • shootNinja

        public void shootNinja(int parameter)
        This method receives the parameter "parameter" from the KeyPressed method and runs the code to shoot the gun. It also displays whether or not a ninja has been hit.
        Parameters:
        parameter - the shooting direction.

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • setHUD

        public void setHUD()
        This method prints the players HUD at the bottom of the screen. The HUD keeps track of how many lives, bullets, and turns of invincibility the player has left.
